intro: Valerianella magna, commonly known as the giant valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often hairy to the touch. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Valerianella magna is known for its mild, aromatic scent, which is similar to that of valerian.
